intro: Crambe orientalis subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental crambe, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in raceme inflorescences, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
